text: Those unfortunate enough to be taken captive by the Arabyans know their fate is to be worked to death fulfilling many exhausting and degrading tasks across the Sultanates!\\n\\n[[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]] [[col:yellow]]Slaves are gained through fighting battles and capturing and upgrading ports.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_slaves]] [[/img]][[col:yellow]]They are used to boost the income, control and growth effects of Infrastructure buildings. They can also be spent on instant building construction or to gain bonuses from provincial Diktats and rites.[[/col]]

Those unfortunate enough to be taken captive by the Dark Elves know their fate is to be worked to death fulfilling many exhausting and degrading tasks across the Druchii empire!\\n\\n[[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]] [[col:yellow]]Slaves are gained through fighting battles, capturing and upgrading ports, and by recruiting Black Arks or Assassin heroes.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_slaves]] [[/img]][[col:yellow]]They are used to boost the income, control and growth effects of Infrastructure buildings. They can also be spent on instant building construction or to gain bonuses from provincial Diktats and rites.[[/col]]

A higher slave population allows the Dark Elves to perform Diktats, conduct Rites and instantly complete building construction. However, more stockpiled slaves means a higher chance of uprisings across the Dark Elf territory.

A higher slave population allows the Arabyans to perform Diktats and instantly complete building construction. However, more stockpiled slaves means a higher chance of uprisings across the Arabyan territory.

Tz’arkan’s Whispers\\n\\nFrom time to time, the Daemon Tz’arkan will torment Malus with whispers encouraging murder, carnage or war in exchange for rewards.
Tzeentch's Whispers\\n\\nFrom time to time, Tzeentch will gift the Golden Magus with visions of murder, carnage or war that end with him being greatly rewarded.
